description: Current price per unit of Ethereum in USD
The total number of mined ETH circulating on the Ethereum network
The market value of all coins in the network. It is calculated by taking the product of Circulating supply & Ethereum's current price
The total number of confirmed on-chain transactions.
The total number of confirmed on-chain transactions by value.
The average Ethereum block size in kilobytes
The average gas used per block in a day on the Ethereum network.
The average gas limit on Ethereum
The average mining fee per transaction in USD
The fraction of total transaction value over the total number of transactions for each day
The number of blocks generated in a day on the Ethereum network.
The volume of USD transacted on Ethereum blockchain in USD.
The average time between blocks generated in seconds.
The average gas price per transaction.
The number of newly created contracts in the network.
The total number of unique active addresses, inclusive of senders and receivers.
The number of addresses that were active as a sender.
The number of addresses that were active as a receiver.

NVT represents the ratio between Market Capitalisation and transferred volume. An upward trend will indicate that the coin pricing is at a premium, whereby Market Capitalisation is growing at a pace greater than that of transferred volume. A downward trend will indicate that the coin pricing is at a discount, whereby Market Capitalisation is growing at a pace smaller than that of transferred volume. A constant trend will mean that both Market Capitalisation and transferred volume are in equlibrium.
Measure of how quickly units are circulating in the network. It is also the inverse of NVT ratio.
The amount of ERC-20 transfers on the Ethereum network.
